intro: Laserpitium nestleri subsp. eliasii, commonly known as Elias's larkspur, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes a variety of herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. Its leaves are compound, with serrated edges, and it thrives in alpine and subalpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
